explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses various machine learning models including ANFIS, ANN, CART, RF, and SVM for predicting household over-indebtedness.
explanations.supervised learning: The study involves supervised learning techniques as it uses labeled data to predict household over-indebtedness.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on classification tasks to correctly identify indebted individuals.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper compares the proposed hybrid model with SVM as one of the reference models.
explanations.SVM: SVM is explicitly mentioned as one of the models used for comparison in the study.
explanations.decision tree: Classification and regression trees (CART) are mentioned as one of the models compared in the study, which is a decision tree-based method.
explanations.neural network: The paper uses artificial neural networks (ANN) and a hybrid ANFIS model, which incorporates neural networks.
